chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To me a part of the body which is swollen looks like little mountain of flesh with something stuffed in the middle.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " flesh " to " heavy " sound, the original meaning is poisonous sore. "Shuowen": "Carbuncle. From the flesh, heavy sound." "Zhou Li‧Tianguan‧Ulcer": "Ulcer doctors palm ulcers, ulcers, gold ulcers, ulcers, ulcers, and ulcers. Zheng Xuan's note: "Swelling, carbuncle and upper-born wound." Jia Gongyan Shu: "It is said that there is carbuncle but the head is not ulcerated."

" Swelling " can indicate muscle swelling. "The Ten Years of Zuo Zhuan-Ding Gong": "The public cried behind closed doors, his eyes swollen.

" Swelling " can also mean swelling and pain. "Lu's Chunqiu-Numbers": "If the shape is not moving, the essence will not flow; if the essence does not flow, the qi will be stagnant. If the head is swollen, the wind will result." Gao You's note: "Swelling and wind are the first diseases."

" Swollen " also means that the object is bloated. "Zhou Li·Kao Gong Ji·Lun Ren": "Where you rub your teeth, it is not cheap on the outside but not frustrated on the inside, and the side is not swollen. It is called the goodness of using fire."
humanum_short_description_en: From " flesh " to " heavy " sound, the original meaning is poisonous sore.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「重」聲，本義為毒瘡。《說文》：「癰也。从肉，重聲。」《周禮‧天官‧瘍醫》：「瘍醫掌腫瘍、潰瘍、金瘍、折瘍之祝藥，劀殺之齊。」鄭玄注：「腫瘍，癰而上生創者。」賈公彥疏：「謂癰而有頭未潰者。」

　　「腫」可表示肌肉浮脹。《左傳‧定公十年》：「公閉門而泣之，目盡腫。」

　　「腫」也可表示脹痛。《呂氏春秋‧盡數》：「形不動則精不流，精不流則氣鬱，鬱處頭則為腫為風。」高誘注：「腫與風，皆首疾。」

　　「腫」也表示物體臃腫。《周禮‧考工記‧輪人》：「凡揉牙，外不廉而內不挫，旁不腫，謂之用火之善。」

腫れる(はれる): to swell (from inflammation), to become swollen

從「 肉 」，「 重 」聲，本義為毒瘡。《說文》：「癰也。从肉，重聲。」《周禮‧天官‧瘍醫》：「瘍醫掌腫瘍、潰瘍、金瘍、折瘍之祝藥，劀殺之齊。」鄭玄注：「腫瘍，癰而上生創者。」賈公彥疏：「謂癰而有頭未潰者。」 「 腫 」可表示肌肉浮脹。《左傳‧定公十年》：「公閉門而泣之，目盡腫。」 「 腫 」也可表示脹痛。《呂氏春秋‧盡數》：「形不動則精不流，精不流則氣鬱，鬱處頭則為腫為風。」高誘注：「腫與風，皆首疾。」 「 腫 」也表示物體臃腫。《周禮‧考工記‧輪人》：「凡揉牙，外不廉而內不挫，旁不腫，謂之用火之善。」
From " flesh" to " heavy" sound, the original meaning is poisonous sore. "Shuowen": "Carbuncle. From the flesh, heavy sound." "Zhou Li‧Tianguan‧Ulcer": "Ulcer doctors palm ulcers, ulcers, gold ulcers, ulcers, ulcers, and ulcers. Zheng Xuan's note: "Swelling, carbuncle and upper-born wound." Jia Gongyan Shu: "It is said that there is carbuncle but the head is not ulcerated." " Swelling" can indicate muscle swelling. "The Ten Years of Zuo Zhuan-Ding Gong": "The public cried behind closed doors, his eyes swollen. " Swelling" can also mean swelling and pain. "Lu's Chunqiu-Numbers": "If the shape is not moving, the essence will not flow; if the essence does not flow, the qi will be stagnant. If the head is swollen, the wind will result." Gao You's note: "Swelling and wind are the first diseases." " Swollen" also means that the object is bloated. "Zhou Li·Kao Gong Ji·Lun Ren": "Where you rub your teeth, it is not cheap on the outside but not frustrated on the inside, and the side is not swollen. It is called the goodness of using fire."

腫字的基本解释

腫
zhǒng
见“肿”。

腫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhǒng］
［《廣韻》之隴切，上腫，章。］
“肿1”的繁体字。
(1)肌肉浮胀。
(2)胀痛；痈。
(3)謂物体臃肿。

腫字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腫； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页989第05
【唐韻】之隴切【集韻】【韻會】主勇切，?音種。【說文】癰也。【廣韻】疾也。【周禮·天官·瘍醫】掌腫瘍，潰瘍，金瘍折瘍之祝藥，劀殺之齊。【註】腫瘍，㿈而上生創者。【爾雅·釋訓】腫足爲尰。【疏】膝之下有瘡腫，是涉水所爲。　又膚肉浮滿也。【史記·倉公傳】後五日當?腫。【前漢·五行志】公閉門而泣之，目盡腫。【後漢·梁皇后紀】從閒以來，加以浮腫。　又【釋名】腫，鍾也。寒熱氣所鍾聚也。　又【增韻】脹也。【管子·輕重篇】無鹽則腫。　又瘣也。【周禮·冬官考工記·輪人】旁不腫。【註】瘣也。
